description:
Ergonomics is the interdisciplinary scientific field concerned with understanding interactions between humans and the systems within which they exist. Ergonomists seek to apply this knowledge to enhance health and safety, comfort, and productivity. This course provides an opportunity for students to undertake an individual workplace based project in any area of ergonomics under the supervision of an academic staff member from any faculty.
. This course had the previous code of HMST6612 which can be viewed in the archived area within the Course and Program site http://www.uq.edu.au/study/archive/index.html
restricted: Available only to GCert/GDip/Master of Ergonomics
